headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Any Minute: Biden Speaks At Rally In Battleground Wisconsin; Biden Addresses Voters In Wisconsin Amid Campaign Doubts; No Relief For Days As West Coast Heat Wave Intensifies. Aired 3:30-4p ET

utterances.speaker: DAVID CHALIAN, CNN POLITICAL DIRECTOR
utterances.sentences: Sort of an OK performance in the interview, I'm not sure that actually saves Joe Biden at this point, because I think there are big questions among Democratic operatives, elected officials, the donor class, whether or not, even at this stage, a week of this conversation has done so much damage as to whether or not it is recoverable for him.

utterances.speaker: BORIS SANCHEZ, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: We also have, go ahead, Gloria.

utterances.speaker: GLORIA BORGER, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: They're kind of tiptoeing around, in many ways, the elephant in the room. And a lot of them don't want to come out and say it right now, they'll say it privately, but they won't say it publicly. And I think it may just be a matter of time.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: We are watching President Biden hug supporters and shake hands with them as he approaches the podium.Before he begins speaking, I want to bring in Evan Osnos, who's standing by for us, just to get a reaction to the analysis we heard from -- from David about this cake potentially already being baked. EVAN OSNOS, BIDEN'S BIOGRAPHER: Yes, I think that's very much the case at this moment, but we're right down to the moment here. But one person who knows that is Joe Biden, a lot on the line.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Let's go ahead and listen to the President.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: Thank you, thank you, thank you.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Let's go, Joe! Let's go, Joe! Let's go, Joe! Let's go, Joe!

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Let's go, Joe! Let's go, Joe! BIDENI got to thank somebody. Gaylord Nelson, I'm back. He first introduced me to Wisconsin a long time ago when I was a kid. I'm only 40 now, but I was a kid back then. Sabrina, thank you for the introduction and for the volunteering for our campaign. And a special thanks to one of the best governors I've ever worked with in my life --

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: -- Tony Evers. We've got a former governor, Jim Doyle, I work for him. Madison Rhodes, mayor -- mayor of this city.And look, we got a guy who has a tough time when an election only gets 70 percent of the vote, Congressman Mark Pocan. Thank you. And so many local leaders are there, including the chair of Wisconsin Democratic Party, Ben Wikler. Ben. Hello, Ben. Folks, did you have a good Fourth of July? (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: By the way, if you wonder whether Trump has it all together, did you ever hear how he explained the Fourth of July?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: When he was president? No, I'm serious. This is true. His explanation of how America won the Revolutionary War. I'm not making this up. He said in his Fourth of July speech five years ago, he said, George Washington's army won the Revolution by taking control of the airports from the British. Don't talk about me misspeaking. Airports from the British in 1776. It's true. He is a stable genius, this man.My friends, I'm in Wisconsin for one reason, because we're going to win Wisconsin.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Win it. And let me tell you how we're going to do it. You know the reason. We're going to do it because of you all in this room, to start with. We're going to stand up for women in America.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: We're going to restore Roe v. Wade --

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: -- to all the land. We're going to stand up for the right to vote again.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: We're going to fight for Medicare and Social Security and child care, elder care, paid leave.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Always grow the economy. We're going to keep lowering the cost of prescription drugs and expanding health care for everyone.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Not just -- look, we're going to protect our children from getting weapons of war off our streets. That's what we're going to do.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: The idea that more children die from gunshot wounds in America is so wrong. It's sick. It really is sick. We're going to keep confronting climate change. And (INAUDIBLE) --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: -- the most important, we're going to save our democracy.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Now, you probably heard, we had a little debate last week. I can't say it was my best performance.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: But ever since then, there's been a lot of speculation. What's Joe going to do? Is he going to stay in the race?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Is he going to drop out? What's he going to do?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Well, here's my answer. I am running and going to win again. Because -- because --[15:35:06] CROWD: Let's go, Joe! Let's go, Joe! Let's go, Joe! Let's go, Joe! Let's go, Joe! --

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: We're going to go. Folks, I'm the sitting president of the United States of America in no small part because of you.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: That's not a joke, in 2020 you came through for me. I'm a nominee of the Democratic Party.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I'm a nominee of this party because millions of Democrats like you just voted for me in primaries all across America.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: You voted for me to be your nominee, no one else. You, the votes, the voters did that.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: And despite -- despite that some folks don't seem to care who you voted for, well guess what, they're trying to push me out in the race.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Well, let me say this as clearly as I can. I'm staying in the race.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I'll beat Donald Trump. I will beat him again in 2020. And by the way, we're going to do it again in 2024.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I learned long ago, when you get knocked down you get back up.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: And I'm not let -- I'm not letting one 90-minute debate wipe out three and a half years of work.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: As the governor said, I've led this nation through the depths of pandem -- through the depths of pandemic to the strongest economy in the world, and that's literally the true.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: And I and you are not finished yet.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: And you probably also noticed a lot of discussion about my age.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I keep seeing all those stories about I'm being too old. Let me say something.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I was too old. I wasn't too old. I wasn't too old to create over 15 million new jobs.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: To make sure 21 million Americans are insured under the Affordable Care Act.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: To beat Big Pharma, the first one to ever do that, and lower the cost of insulin to $35 (INAUDIBLE). Was I too old to relieve student debt for nearly 5 million Americans and grow the economy?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Too old to put the first Black woman on the Supreme Court of the United States of America?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: To sign the Respect for Marriage Act?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Was I too old to sign the most significant gun safety law in 30 years?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: To pass the biggest climate bill in the history of the world, not here, in the history of the world.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: But then, my critics say, sure. But he did all that, but that was in the past. What about now?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: How about the 200,000 jobs we announced yesterday?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: So, let me ask you, what do you think? You think I'm too old to restore Roe v. Wade to law of the land?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: You think I'm too old to ban assault weapons again?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: To get childcare, eldercare, for working families in need of the nation.(CROSSTALK) BIDEN: To make billionaires finally start to pay something beyond 8.2 percent of their tax rate? (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you, you think I'm too old to beat Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I can hardly wait anyway. Folks, let's focus on what really matters. We're running against the biggest liar and the biggest threat. No, really? The biggest liar, and biggest threat to our democracy --

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Over 150 presidential historians voted him the worst president in American history.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: By the way, I'll be damned. I'm glad I went with him. He can, I'll be damned. Let me talk about my son that way.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: But how do we know he said -- how do we know he said this? And I'm not making himself. A four-star Marine General, his own former Chief of Staff was with him and he told us that's what he said. He's not the only former Trump -- Trump official warning us about how bad Trump is, including the former Secretary of Defense and even his own Vice President, they refused to endorse him. Says a lot about who Trump is and says a lot about what he isn't.By the way, I couldn't ponder. I don't know, I just -- I guess I shouldn't say it. By the way, I couldn't be prouder to have your support, and the support of our great Vice President of the United States, Kamala Harris.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Trump is a convicted felon. Found guilty, 34 felonies.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Trying to hide hush money payments to a porn star. Another jury found Trump sexually assaulted a woman in a public place and has been fined $90 million for defaming her.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Ninety million dollars, they've only been banked about 20 times, but I don't know. This so-called great businessman owes over $400 million in fines after being convicted in New York State of business fraud. Already convicted. Fined $400 million. Donald Trump isn't just a convicted criminal. He's a one-man crime wave.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: But Trump's biggest lie of all is he had nothing to do with the insurrection of January 6th. We all saw it with our own eyes.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you something. After what Trump did on January 6th, why would anyone ever let him be near the Oval Office again?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Folks, the issue of this election is what kind of America do we want to be? What kind of America do we want to be? We want to be a country of anger, revenge, and retribution. A country of hope and optimism and possibilities as we've always been.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I want a country where women have a right to make their own health care decisions.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Trump wants an America where abortion is banned and women are punished. I want an America where healthcare is a right, not a privilege.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Trump wants to throw tens of millions of people who couldn't get insurance any other way than Obamacare, off of Obamacare.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I want America where the very wealthy begin to pay their fair share.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Trump wants to give the very wealthy a visual. Last time out when he was president, he gave me $2 trillion tax cut, creating the largest deficit any president has in one term. Now he's announced he wants another five billion trillion -- trillion not billion, $5 trillion tax cut after already leaving the largest deficit. CROWD(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: If this -- I mean it's hard to make this up. I want to protect Social Security and Medicare.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: He wants to cut Social Security and Medicare.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: So, he can cut taxes for the very wealthy. I want to ban assault weapons and require universal background checks.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: You all heard him promise the NRA, he promised the National Rifle Association, I will do nothing about guns. That's what he said. I will do nothing about guns. And he means it.I want January 6th insurrectionists to serve their full prison terms.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Trump wants to pardon you. Folks, you can't be pro- insurrectionists and pro-American at the same time.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: This is so damn serious. You can't love your country only when you win.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Look, you've been standing a long time. Let me close with this. Ultimately, the American presidency is about character.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: The character of the president who holds the job.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Because with the immunities he's talking, the Supreme Court just talked about, it gets down to that. It gets down to that. It's about honesty.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Integrity. Do they respect people? Or do they incite violence and hate? Can they honor the oath of the Constitution and uphold the oath of office? Well, I don't think it's an exaggeration to say that Trump has failed on every one of these character tests. Everyone. And what's worse, the Supreme Court has just ruled that there are virtually no limits on the power of the presidency. I know it sounds bizarre, but that's what they ruled. A frightening decision!

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: According to the extreme majority of the Supreme Court, the president is now above the law. We just celebrated the Fourth of July, saying we will not be ruled by a king. And this Supreme Court he appointed proved this new law.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: It's in a dangerous precedent, especially if Donald Trump has returned to the president, just think about it.The second term, this next term, whomever is the president is going to appoint at least two new appointees. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: The second Trump term where there are no limits. Supreme Court Justice Sotomayor warned us about that in her dissent in that case. She noted that based on a majority decision, Trump can take out his opponents. I mean, physically take them out, take bribes, lead a coup and be immune to ever being held accountable for it. If he did it while he was president, according to the Supreme Court.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I mean where the hell are we?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: So, he really could become a dictator that he promised to be on day one. For over two centuries, America has been a free democratic nation. And I'll be damn (ph) of the year 2024, just two years before our 250th anniversary of this na -- as a nation. I'll let Donald Trump take this away.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Folks, this is not hyperbole. This race is about our freedom. UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: It's about the very soul of America.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Are we prepared to fight for that?

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: I know I am. And I will.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: And folks, I have never been more optimistic about America's future because the American people are decent, good, honorable, just to remember who in God's name we are. We're the United States of America.I mean, think about it. Think about it in literal terms. And there's nothing, nothing beyond our capacity when we stand together. So, let's stand together, win this election and exile Donald Trump politically. God bless you all, and may God protect our troops. Thank you (INAUDIBLE). Thank you. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Quote, let me say this as clearly as I can, I'm staying in the race. President Biden in Madison, Wisconsin, acknowledging his lackluster debate performance last week, saying it was not his best, but saying, quote, my answer, I'm running and I'm going to win again. The president acknowledging that there are questions about his future at the top of the Democratic ticket, even saying they're trying to push me out as someone in the crowd as he was walking out unfurled a sign that said, quote, Pass the torch, Joe.

utterances.speaker: BROWN
utterances.sentences: Right. And so, the question is, as we watch his campaign speech there, Gloria Borger is how much did that matter? How much does that ease the concerns of those like that person there who unfurled that banner saying, pass the torch (INAUDIBLE)?

utterances.speaker: CHALIAN
utterances.sentences: Yes. No, he -- he accomplished two of the things that he set out to accomplish. Show that he has the energy and capacity to wage this fight. And by I mean this fight, the contrast with Donald Trump. So, by -- by being energetic, that's one thing. Show he's got the energy for this, but taking it to Donald Trump nearly throughout the entire speech, other than, as you said, at the top Boris, the news of it that he wanted to get out is, I'm in this, I'm digging in, my head is down. I'm not listening to any of these calls to get out of the race. All of that was clear.Now the question becomes, does a 17-minute or 18-minute energetic speech where you are, you know, reading from prompter and taking the fight to Donald Trump in the way Democrats want to see. Does that ease the concerns? I don't know that we know the answer to that. I mean, we're going to wait for a couple of things to happen here. Obviously, this interview is happening. But I think the next two big things that we have to watch for here, the return of members of Congress to Capitol Hill next week after they've been home for the 4th of July recess, heard from a lot of Democratic constituents. And what that told them, especially the Democrats in battleground districts. And especially on the House side because the House for Democrats is actually within grasp of the majority this November. And if that is slipping away that is going to be a big, big area of concern. And then the second thing is, these battleground state polls, we've seen a lot of national polls come out since the debate. Wait for next week in the round of, you know, does Wisconsin still look like it is within grasp? Or does it look like it's slipping away? Do states like Minnesota, New Mexico, New Hampshire, Virginia, look like they're actually becoming more competitive and not being put away and the battleground map is expanding. If that is the case, too, I'm not sure these 17 minutes of a very the energetic speech giving the kind of fight that Democrats want to see will be the only thing that he and the campaign in the White House need to do to quell those concerns.

utterances.speaker: BORGER
utterances.sentences: And -- and Hakeem Jeffries is going to be very important here in terms of the House because he's talking to all of his members, and he's going to hear from them about whether they believe that Joe Biden is going to drag them down. Now you hear this speech as David was saying, as I was saying, as energetic. He did a good job with it. But I think the reality is, how is it going to affect Democrats down ballot? And this is something Biden cares about. And we don't know the answer to that.

utterances.speaker: BROWN
utterances.sentences: We don't. And -- and what I'm wondering is, you know, we obviously see the polls, but earlier before we heard from President Biden, you said, David, that you're hearing from your sources that basically the cake is baked, right? And you see someone there with that banner that they unfurled saying, pass the torch. And I'm wondering how prevalent is that sentiment among (INAUDIBLE) --

utterances.speaker: CHALIAN
utterances.sentences: And I want to be clear when I say the cake is baked, I don't think that that's Joe Biden's perspective obviously, right?

utterances.speaker: CHALIAN
utterances.sentences: And he's the decider on this.

utterances.speaker: CHALIAN
utterances.sentences: Right? I am -- what I'm describing is what these Democratic donors, campaign operatives, elected officials in the last 24 hours of conversations have been saying to me, obviously all eager to watch today and see this interview. But that has been the totality of the kind of conversation that I've been hearing from those folks is, is raising the question. Even with a good speech, even if he has a decent interview, is this actually a recoverable candidacy to be in contention with Donald Trump?And quite frankly, you asked Gerry Connolly, that earlier Democratic member from Virginia, and he said, we don't know the answer to that.

utterances.speaker: CHALIAN
utterances.sentences: That doesn't sound like ringing confidence to me in this moment.

utterances.speaker: BORGER
utterances.sentences: I think he was also trying to make the point and correct me if I'm wrong here, that I'm the nominee. I'm the one who was nominated, and nobody can take your votes away.

utterances.speaker: BORGER
utterances.sentences: And, you know, don't, don't forget that. Because if something like that were to happen, the people who want me to be the Democratic nominee would be disenfranchised. And you know, he didn't quite come out and say that, but that was his -- that was his clear implication here, which is, look, I'm the nominee, I got the nomination, fair and square. This is what the people wanted, and they're not -- they're trying to push me out, whomever they are.

utterances.speaker: BROWN
utterances.sentences: And I'm wondering, Evan as we run out of time, unfortunately, you know, we have, what David said about, oh, unfortunately we do have to go, sadly. Thank you all so much. We always want to go over, right?Everyone, thank you. We'll be right back. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: BROWN
utterances.sentences: Nearly 140 million people will be baking in the scorching heat this holiday weekend, and all that heat is fueling the California wildfires.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes, this is the French Fire which erupted yesterday. It's burning near Yosemite National Park, forcing hundreds to evacuate. Meantime, the Thompson Fire also raging out of control, burning through more than 3,500 acres in Butte County. CNN's Natasha Chen joins us now. She's live from Los Angeles.Natasha?
